page.title: 16ANIMALS IN GRANTOWN ON SPEY
page.content:
The forests and moorlands around Grantown are rich in wildlife. In the forests{Red Squirrels}are common and in more remote parts{Pine Marten}and {Foxes}are to be found. {Rabbits}are common near the sandy soils near the river, with{Hares}being found in the higher areas. This provdes food for {stoats, weasels}and{polecats.
Deer also abound. Near the town{Roe } {Deer}are often seen, and{Red Deer}may make their way down to the lower slopes, especially in poor weather. In recent years{Reindeer}have been reintroduced to the Cairngorms. Also found in the remoter parts of the hills are{wild goats,}which can cause great damage to the grouse moor. Many of these animals can be seen at the{Highland Wildlife Park}at Kincraig, about 25km from Grantown.
